meanings.definition: An official in a government department, typically one perceived as being concerned with procedural correctness at the expense of people's needs.
meanings.sent1: The bureaucrat processed the paperwork efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The city hall bureaucrat reviewed the forms carefully.
meanings.sent3: The bureaucrat made sure every box was ticked, even for a lemonade stand permit.
meanings.sent4: She was a bureaucrat, turning red tape into a colorful ribbon of rules.
meanings.sent5: The bureaucrat's desk was a maze of forms and folders, like a paper jungle.

meanings.definition: A person who is rigidly devoted to the details of administrative procedure.
meanings.sent1: The meticulous bureaucrat double-checked every document.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the office bureaucrat due to his attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The bureaucrat insisted on alphabetizing the office supplies by color.
meanings.sent4: She was a bureaucrat of organization, arranging chaos into order.
meanings.sent5: The bureaucrat's precision was like a finely tuned clock, ticking methodically.
